title: "Does Free Speech Protect Trump’s Election Lies?"
excerpt: "The freedom of speech guarantees by the First Amendment expressly aim to protect unorthodox thought — unpopular views and the ideas of dissidents which majorities are prone to label ‘false.’ A serious tension exists between protecting free speech under the First Amendment and combating the spread of falsehoods that can endanger a free society."
